page.title: 05THE MILL,RADFORD.
page.content: Near Radford there is a little lane which is signposted{FARM AND MILL}.The mill was built in 1680 and later knocked down and built again.Most of the mill-stones were made in France.It is believed that the cottage was a forester's cottage long ago.The flour was made into bread.The mill stopped working in 1943.There is a man -made stream which was built long ago because the ground was flooded and they had to build the mill on higher ground,and so had to divert the stream.The baker used to sleep above the ovens,which were big enough to put a child in.The cottage was built in 1580.In the orchard there is a very ,very big walnut tree.There is an original wall in front of the cottage. The mill has never been lived in before.
